business.headline: Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

ICICI Prudential Asset Management files for IPO. Check offer detailsThe IPO will be an offer for sale of up to 1.77 crore shares, representing 10% of the company's equity share capital. The shares will be sold by Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited (PCHL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based insurer Prudential.
Crizac IPO listing: Shares debut at 14% premium on Dalal StreetCrizac share price: The stock opened at Rs 280 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) showing a 14.29% premium on its Dalal Street debut.

Will Rs 2,000 SIP make you rich? CA breaks it downMany young investors trust SIPs to secure their future but without clear goals, even long-term discipline might not be enough, warns CA and financial planning advisor Abhishek Walia.

Studying abroad? Here's how you can manage your finances smartlyStudying abroad is a huge step, and an amazing opportunity. But a bit of smart financial planning can help you enjoy every moment without money worries.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 158.94 points to 83,553.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.70 points to 25,480.80 as of 9:30 am.

Wolfspeed shares surge 248% in 5 days. What's powering this Nasdaq stock?Wolfspeed shares opened with a 43% jump on Tuesday over the previous day's close of $1.18 and reached an intraday high of $3.33. The stock ended the day at $2.52, up 9%.

Who is Sabih Khan? Apple's new COO overtaking Jeff WilliamsThe announcement came on Tuesday, with the company confirming that Sabih Khan will step into the role later this month. He takes over from Jeff Williams, who has held the post since 2015.

RCB overtakes CSK as IPL's most valuable team, league now worth $18.5 billionA report released by investment bank Houlihan Lokey said the IPL's business value rose by 13% in 2025 to $18.5 billion. At the same time, the brand value of the league increased by 14% to nearly $4 billion.

India, US hopeful of inking trade deal, but New Delhi firm on protecting key sectorsIndia and the United States are nearing a trade deal, with negotiations ongoing. India has taken a firm stance on protecting sensitive sectors, particularly wheat, maize, dairy, and genetically grown crops.

Will central government employees' dearness allowance reach 60%?The government revises the DA/DR rates twice a year, effective from January 1 and July 1. However, the official announcement generally comes a few months later.
Sensex closes 271 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 270 points to end at 83,712.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 61.20 points to close at 25,522.50.

Fincluencer explains why India's rich are planning to retire abroadIndia's rich are rethinking where they retire and how they invest. Finfluencer Akshat Shrivastava says it's not a whim but a calculated response to India's tax structure on wealth and income.

Earning Rs 80,000 a month and still broke? Finance coach explains what's wrongMany in their 20s and 30s are earning more than generations before, but their money often disappears into lifestyle upgrades, digital conveniences, and impulse-driven choices. The result is a sense of helplessness despite a good paycheck.

Bill Gates no longer in world's top 10 richest; trails former Microsoft CEOBill Gates now ranks behind Michael Dell, who is at number 11 with $137 billion, and Steve Ballmer, his former Microsoft colleague, who is far ahead at number 5 with $172 billion.

All you need to know about UAE's Golden Visa: Cost, application, documentationUnlike earlier Golden Visas that required big investments in property or business, this new scheme allows skilled professionals to apply based on their talent and work experience.

Jane Street vs Sebi: All you need to know about the caseAt the heart of the controversy is a long-running investigation into the firm's index arbitrage strategy, one that Jane Street insists is standard and legal, but which Sebi believes may have distorted prices in India's rapidly growing equity derivatives market.
Filed your ITR early? Will you get a faster tax refund?Filing an ITR early improves your chances of a quicker refund, but only if your return is correct, complete and verified on time.
Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Jane Street to challenge Sebi trading ban, slams charges as inflammatory: ReportIn an internal email to staff over the weekend, the US-based firm said it was "beyond disappointed" by Sebi's accusations, which it described as "extremely inflammatory."

Have lost their tax edge: Expert sounds the alarm on ULIPsThe tax expert said ULIPs no longer guarantee tax-free returns. Investors paying over Rs 2.5 lakh annually may face capital gains tax—making mutual funds a more efficient alternative.
Sensex opens 65 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 72.04 points to 83,514.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.50 points to 25,477.80 as of 9:40 am.

Market opening: How will Sensex, Nifty react to Trump's tariff announcement?While a US-India trade deal may help improve mood, the benefits may be limited to specific sectors. For today's session, Nifty to find support between 25,330 and 25,180 and face resistance near 25,510 and 25,630, say experts.

Trump's tariff list: 14 countries, new rates, and what they export to AmericaUS President Donald Trump confirmed that letters had been sent to several nations, warning them that if new trade agreements are not reached by August 1, increased import duties will be implemented.

Necktie Nomics: Can the RBI Governor's tie colour predict rate moves?An SBI report looked at the ties worn by the RBI Governor during Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meetings. Instead of only watching inflation numbers or GDP data, they turned their attention to the shades of silk draped around the Governor's neck.
Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 25,500; HUL gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 9.61 points higher at 83,442.50, while the NSE Nifty remained flat to end below 25,500.
GCCs push India's office leasing to new heights: ReportGCCs are no longer coming to India just for cheaper costs. They now see India as a strong base for talent, innovation and large modern offices.

entertainment.headline: Did Akshay Kumar use teleprompter for Kannappa? Internet thinks soAkshay Kumar seemed to have used a teleprompter on the sets of 'Kannappa', in which he played the role of Lord Shiva. Internet dug out a video, which is now going on social media, where Kumar is seemingly reading his lines from the teleprompter.

Salman Khan steps out with high security to attend Sangeeta Bijlani's birthday bashSalman Khan attended his ex-girlfriend Sangeeta Bijlani's birthday party in Mumbai on Wednesday. He arrived at the venue with high security.

Dubai Royal Sheikha Mahra, French Montana spark dating rumours in ParisSheikha Mahra and French Montana sparked dating rumors after being seen together in Paris. Instagram posts and past Dubai outings fuelled speculation, following Mahra's high-profile divorce and business launch.

HBO Max returns: Warner Bros. drops 'Max' rebrand after backlashWarner Bros. Discovery has rebranded Max back to HBO Max, citing the strong legacy and consumer loyalty tied to the HBO name, after the Max brand failed to resonate with audiences.

Wednesday Season 2 trailer out: Jenna Ortega returns with darker twistWednesday Season 2 trailer teases dark twists, new characters, and Jenna Ortega's return. Steve Buscemi joins as principal, Joanna Lumley debuts as Grandmama, and global "Doom Tour" promotions kick off.

Diljit Dosanjh shares new BTS from Border 2, Varun Dhawan-Ahan Shetty make cameoDespite the row over his casting in 'Border 2', Diljit Dosanjh seems unfazed. The actor is enjoying himself on set, as seen in his latest video.

Who was Humaira Asghar Ali, the Pakistani actor found dead at home?Pakistani actor and model Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her Karachi apartment, with the cause of death still under investigation. Known for her roles in TV dramas and the film 'Jalaibee', she gained fame through the reality show 'Tamasha Ghar'.

Siddu Jonnalagadda turns raw and intense for Badass, makers unveil posterAfter the massive success of the 'Tillu' franchise, Siddu Jonnalagadda is set to shed the lingering image with 'Badass', a raw, intense film directed by Ravikanth Perepu. The makers released the first-look poster recently.

Slow Horses renewed: Gary Oldman's spy-thriller upgraded for seventh seasonActor Gary Oldman's British spy-thriller series 'Slow Horses' has been renewed for the seventh season. The show is based on Mick Herron's spy novel series 'Slough House'.

Mahavatar Narsimha trailer: Lord Vishnu and Prahald's epic tale comes aliveThe trailer for 'Mahavatar Narsimha' has been unveiled, showcasing a grand and emotional depiction of a pivotal mythological tale centred on Prahlada's devotion and divine intervention. Set to release in 3D across five Indian languages in July 2025, the film also marks the beginning of the ambitious Mahavatar Cinematic Universe.

Ali Fazal surprises fans at Metro In Dino screening, video goes viralAli Fazal surprised fans with an unannounced visit to a theatre screening of 'Metro... In Dino', leaving the audience thrilled and the moment going viral. The film is already receiving a positive response from viewers.

What to expect from James Gunn's Superman, and why watching Man of Steel is crucialJames Gunn's 'Superman' might bring a new and exciting look, full of action and visuals, but might not go too deep into the characters. However, watching 'Man of Steel' before can help you understand the background better.

John Cena jokes Margot Robbie's Barbie was a mistake that happened over dinnerHollywood star John Cena landed a role in the 2023 hit 'Barbie' through an unexpected meeting at a dinner hosted by Margot Robbie. He appeared in a cameo role in the Oscar-nominated film.

Four Years Later tops OTT romance this weekend, here's all about Shahana's showActor Shahana Goswami's Australian-Indian romantic-drama 'Four Years Later' is all set for its digital debut in India. The series explores the emotional and cultural challenges faced by a migrant couple in an arranged marriage. Here's when and where to binge-watch the show.

Ballard OTT guide: Cast, story, and what to expect from Bosch spinoffOTT's 'The Bosch' spin-off 'Ballard' dives deep into cold cases and corruption. The show premiered on July 9.  Here's all about it.

All about Charlize Theron's The Old Guard 2, Netflix film trending amid poor reviews'The Old Guard 2', headlined by Charlize Theron, has taken over the top spot on Netflix's global top 10 movies for the week. The film ranked number 1 on Netflix in 74 countries, including India.

Timothee Chalamet and Zendaya's Dune 3 official title confirmed: ReportsDenis Villeneuve's 'Dune 3' has entered production. The film's official title has been confirmed and, contrary to fans' predictions, it's not 'Dune Messiah'. Find out more details here.

Actor Shiva Rajkumar channels vintage spy look in 666 Operation Dream TheatreThe makers of '666 Operation Dream Theatre' unveiled Shiva Rajkumar's first look. Directed by Hemanth Rao, the film is said to be a spy action thriller. The retro styling and tone hint at a tribute to old-school espionage dramas.

general news.headline: Tremors jolt Delhi-NCR after 4.4 magnitude earthquake hits Haryana townStrong earthquake tremors jolted Delhi and its adjoining regions on Thursday morning. It started at 9.04 am and lasted for a few seconds.

Trump slaps 50% tariff on Brazil after targeting 7 nations, cites Bolsonaro trialThe new tariff directives, communicated via official letters to foreign leaders and shared on Trump's Truth Social platform, outline duty hikes on eight countries. All new tariffs will take effect on August 1.

Man arrested for filming women on Bengaluru streets, posting videos without consentA woman called out an Instagram account for secretly filming women in popular areas in Bengaluru without consent and posting them online. After her video went viral, police arrested 26-year-old Gurudeep Singh for posting the reels and harassing women.

Girls stripped for period check after blood stains found in school washroomAfter spotting drops of blood in the school bathroom, the principal summoned girls from Classes 5 to 10 to the school hall for a strip-check.

Amit Shah shares post-retirement plan: Vedas, Upanishads and farmingUnion Home Minister Amit Shah recently revealed his post-retirement plans. The sixty-year-old task-master said he would immerse himself in Vedas, Upanishads, and natural farming. Citing health risks linked to the use of chemical fertilisers, Shah batted for the promotion of organic farming.

Arvind Kejriwal says he deserves Nobel prize, BJP suggests 'corruption category'Speaking in Chandigarh at the launch of the Punjabi edition of a book titled 'The Kejriwal Model', the AAP supremo said that despite repeated attempts to obstruct his government's work in Delhi, his administration had delivered effectively.

MLA canteen caterer's licence suspended after Sena legislator's stale food claimThe Maharashtra Food and Drugs Administration has suspended the licence of the caterer operating the canteen of the Akashwani residence for MLAs in Mumbai a day after Shiv Sena legislator Sanjay Gaikwad was caught on camera thrashing a staff over stale food.

Aadhaar isn't proof of citizenship. Then how does it fetch voting rights?The Election Commission is holding an intensive revision of voter rolls across India, beginning with Bihar, to update them and weed out non-citizens. But why did India allow non-citizens to get into the rolls in the first place? Form 6, which people fill to register as voters, doesn't demand proof of citizenship in the first place.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
